items.title: #1 - Introduction - Modern JavaScript Syntaxes in Bangla ( ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶Ç‡¶≤‡¶æ ) - ES6 + in Bangla
items.description:
JavaScript (JS) is a lightweight, object-oriented, interpreted programming language. In 1996, Netscape submitted JS to ECMA International to be standardized, which lead to a new version of the language called ECMAScript. It took nearly 15 years for ECMAScript to see major changes, and since then, it has been updated regularly. The biggest update occurred in 2015 when ECMAScript 6 (ES6) or ECMAScript 2015 (ES2015) was officially released. ES6 features modernized JavaScript and made it more popular. JavaScript is a very dynamic language and is updating regularly. It's a challenge for programmers to run and keep themselves updated with its constant pace.

In this Crash Course, I would take you through some important and modern JavaScript syntaxes. I would try to cover those features which will make your life easier when you try to learn some modern JavaScript frameworks or libraries like React.js, Angular, Vue.js etc. Not only that, this will empower your JavaScript skills I believe.

Full Playlist link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PWXkYBmlbB4&list=PLHiZ4m8vCp9MFjMRp9EEHWKArbi0wdgXG

Please note that, I will keep adding videos in this playlist time to time. Please hit the subscribe button and click the bell icon so that you can get instant notification whenever I upload a new video.

Reference:

1. w3Schools JavaScript Tutorial: https://www.w3schools.com/js/
2. Facebook Page: https://facebook.com/letslearnwithsumit
3. Public Facebook Group: https://facebook.com/groups/learnwithsumit

items.title: ECMAScript 2023 - ES14: Discover Four Exciting New Array Features!
items.description:
Welcome to our latest video on ECMAScript 2023 (ES14), where we dive into four fantastic new features for manipulating arrays. Join us as we explore Array with(), Array toReversed(), Array toSorted(), and Array.toSpliced() ‚Äì powerful additions that will revolutionize how you work with arrays in JavaScript.

In this comprehensive tutorial, we'll provide in-depth explanations and practical examples for each of these exciting new features. Learn how Array with() simplifies array creation and initialization, making your code more concise and readable. Discover the convenience of Array toReversed(), which allows you to effortlessly reverse the order of array elements, saving you time and effort.

We'll also explore Array toSorted(), a game-changer for sorting arrays. With this feature, you can easily sort your arrays in ascending or descending order with just a few lines of code. And lastly, we'll introduce you to Array.toSpliced(), which empowers you to remove or replace specific elements in an array without modifying the original array.

Whether you're a beginner or an experienced JavaScript developer, this video has something for everyone. Stay ahead of the curve and level up your coding skills by embracing these powerful new array features in ECMAScript 2023. Don't miss out ‚Äì watch now and take your JavaScript programming to the next level!

Remember to like, comment, and subscribe to our channel for more exciting ECMAScript tutorials and updates. Stay tuned for future videos where we'll explore even more cutting-edge features and enhancements in the world of JavaScript. Happy coding!

‚ñ¨ Contents of this video  ‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨

0:00 - Intro
00:47 - Array .toReversed()
03:07 - Array .toSpliced()
08:42 - Array .with()
10:21 - Array .toSorted()
27:12 - Final words
28:01 - Outro

items.title: JavaScript Object.groupBy() Mastery: Grouping Made Effortless!
items.description:
Dive deep into the powerful JavaScript Object.groupBy() method with our comprehensive tutorial! Learn how to leverage this experimental feature to effortlessly group elements from any iterable based on custom callback functions.

Uncover the secrets of Object.groupBy() and revolutionize your data manipulation skills! This groundbreaking method creates a game-changing paradigm in JavaScript, allowing you to organize and analyze data like never before.

In this tutorial, we'll walk you through:

Understanding the syntax and usage of Object.groupBy()
Writing effective callback functions for dynamic grouping
Real-world examples showcasing its practical applications
Tips and best practices for optimal performance

Elevate your JavaScript expertise and stay ahead of the curve with Object.groupBy()!
